What Makes The Best Pea Coats For Men?

Weight

The weight of a pea coat, whether you’re looking at a classic navy style or a modern twist, plays a huge role in when and where you can wear it. Traditionally, men’s pea coats tend to be on the heavier side since they’re made from thick wool (or, more often these days, a thick wool blend), which adds to their iconic structure and provides warmth. That heft is part of what makes wearing a pea coat feel so substantial and such a great solution for those who need a warm yet chic winter coat.

However, modern versions come in various weights, giving you more options depending on your climate or comfort preference. I’d recommend that you pick a weight that suits when and where you’ll be wearing it.

Material Composition

Next, you should consider the material you’d most prefer a pea coat to be made from. As we outlined at the start of the article, the traditional men’s pea coat is made from 100% wool, but there are not a ton of modern men’s pea coats that are only made from wool. That’s for a couple of reasons, including the fact that adding some synthetic materials can make pea coats both more windproof and lighter as well.

That’s a great combination for a winter coat if you ask me. Exactly how much wool you should look for in a pea coat depends on your personal preference, as well as the weather conditions you see yourself wearing it.

Fit & Rise

Lastly, you’ll want to think about how you’d like your new pea coat to fit and where it should hit in terms of length. Some might argue that a pea coat should always land at the mid-thigh for that classic look, but I don’t think that that’s a hard rule. Waist-length pea coats can also be stylish and practical, and these are debatably more popular these days.

Your proportions are also an important factor to consider in this context. If you’re looking to create the illusion of height, then a slightly longer coat can help. On the other hand, if you’re tall, then a traditional shorter pea coat can balance out your proportions nicely. Also, consider whether you want a snug or looser fit—both can look sharp depending on your personal style.

How We Chose

A new pea coat can represent a significant investment for many people, and with that in mind, I take great care in providing advice that will help FashionBeans readers make the right purchase for them. When it comes to the best pea coats for men, I focused on offering a variety of options instead of listing a bunch of men’s pea coats that all look the same.

While I was evaluating different options for this list of the best pea coats for men, I paid special attention to three key factors we prioritize here at FashionBeans:

Brand Reputation: Whether the coat comes from a famous brand with decades of history or a newer company, I always ensure that the brand has a strong reputation for producing high-quality, reliable products.

Design: As someone passionate about fashion, I have to assess whether a pea coat offers something distinctive in terms of style or detail. If it doesn’t have something that sets it apart, then I’m hesitant to say it’s a must-have.

Price: Although some pea coats on this list might lean toward the pricier side, I always ensure that each one offers value that matches its cost. That will help you feel that your investment is worthwhile and avoid any buyer’s regret.

At the end of the day, I really love my pick for the overall best pea coat for men, the wantdo Men’s Wool Blend Jacket Stand Collar Windproof Pea Coat. I think that it’s a great choice for anyone who wants a thoroughly modern version of the pea coat that’s form-fitting and incredibly cool.
